00015 /// \file
00016 /// Provides the hood instructions
00017 
00018 #include <machine.hpp>
00019 #include <instructions.hpp>
00020 
00021 class HoodInstructions {
00022     
00023     protected:
00024         
00025         static Index export_index;
00026         static Data * result;
00027         static Address filter;
00028         static Address fuse;
00029         
00030     public:
00031         
00032         static Data dummy_result;
00033         
00034         static void fold_hood(Machine & machine, Data & result) {
00035             Index export_index = machine.nextInt8();
00036             Data export_value = machine.stack.pop();
00037             result = machine.stack.pop();
00038             Address fuse = machine.stack.popAddress();
00039             
00040             HoodInstructions::export_index = export_index;
00041             HoodInstructions::result = &result;
00042             HoodInstructions::fuse = fuse;
00043             
00044             machine.thisMachine().imports[export_index] = export_value;
00045             
00046             machine.current_neighbour = machine.hood.begin();
00047             
00048             machine.environment.push(result);
00049             machine.environment.push(export_value);
00050             machine.call(fuse,fold_hood_step);
00051         }
00052         
00053         static void fold_hood_step(Machine & machine) {
00054             machine.environment.pop(2);
00055             *result = machine.stack.pop();
00056             if (++machine.current_neighbour != machine.hood.end()){
00057                 machine.environment.push(*result);
00058                 machine.environment.push(machine.current_neighbour->imports[export_index]);
00059                 machine.call(fuse,fold_hood_step);
00060             } else {
00061                 machine.stack.push(*result);
00062             }
00063         }
00064         
00065         static void fold_hood_plus(Machine & machine, Data & result) {
00066             Index export_index = machine.nextInt8();
00067             Data export_value = machine.stack.pop();
00068             Address filter = machine.stack.popAddress();
00069             Address fuse = machine.stack.popAddress();
00070             
00071             HoodInstructions::export_index = export_index;
00072             HoodInstructions::result = &result;
00073             HoodInstructions::filter = filter;
00074             HoodInstructions::fuse = fuse;
00075             
00076             machine.thisMachine().imports[export_index] = export_value;
00077             
00078             machine.current_neighbour = machine.hood.begin();
00079             
00080             machine.environment.push(export_value);
00081             machine.call(filter,fold_hood_plus_first_filter);
00082         }
00083         
00084         static void fold_hood_filter_next(Machine & machine){
00085             *result = machine.stack.pop();
00086             if (++machine.current_neighbour != machine.hood.end()){
00087                 machine.environment.push(machine.current_neighbour->imports[export_index]);
00088                 machine.call(filter,fold_hood_plus_step_filter);
00089             } else {
00090                 machine.stack.push(*result);
00091             }
00092         }
00093         
00094         static void fold_hood_plus_first_filter(Machine & machine){
00095             machine.environment.pop(1);
00096             fold_hood_filter_next(machine);
00097         }
00098         
00099         static void fold_hood_plus_step_filter(Machine & machine){
00100             machine.environment.pop(1);
00101             Data import = machine.stack.pop();
00102             machine.environment.push(*result);
00103             machine.environment.push(import);
00104             machine.call(fuse,fold_hood_plus_step_fuse);
00105         }
00106         
00107         static void fold_hood_plus_step_fuse(Machine & machine){
00108             machine.environment.pop(2);
00109             fold_hood_filter_next(machine);
00110         }
00111         
00112 };
00113 
00114 Index   HoodInstructions::export_index;
00115 Data *  HoodInstructions::result;
00116 Address HoodInstructions::filter;
00117 Address HoodInstructions::fuse;
00118 Data    HoodInstructions::dummy_result;
00119 
00120 namespace Instructions {
00121     
00122     /// \name Hood instructions
00123     /// \{
00124     
00125     /// Fold all imported values for a specific neighbourhood variable and update the corresponding export.
00126     /**
00127      * The fuse function is used to consecutively fuse the previous fuse result with the import value of the next neighbour.
00128      * The import value from the first neighbour (ie. this machine) will be fused with the given starting value.
00129      * 
00130      * The value of the neighbour hood variable (ie. export) of this machine is set before the folding process starts.
00131      * 
00132      * For example, a neighbourhood with three neighbours (including this machine) is folded like this:
00133      * \dot
00134      * digraph Folding {
00135      *   node [fontsize=10,width=0,height=0];
00136      *   start -> a -> b -> c -> result;
00137      *   "new export value" -> "export of this machine" -> a;
00138      *   "import of neighbour 1" -> b;
00139      *   "import of neighbour 2" -> c;
00140      *   a [shape=box,label=fuse];
00141      *   b [shape=box,label=fuse];
00142      *   c [shape=box,label=fuse];
00143      * }
00144      * \enddot
00145      * 
00146      * \deprecated Implemented for MIT Proto compatibility.
00147      * \note There is currently no way of doing this without using deprecated instructions. (This will be fixed soon.)
00148      * 
00149      * \param Int8 The index of the neighbourhood (ie. import/export) variable.
00150      * \param Address The (address of the) fuse function. (The fold function must take two parameters.)
00151      * \param Data The value to start with.
00152      * \param Data The new export value for this Machine.
00153      * 
00154      * \return Data the result of the folding process.
00155      */
00156     void FOLD_HOOD(Machine & machine){
00157         HoodInstructions::fold_hood(machine,HoodInstructions::dummy_result);
00158     }
00159     
00160     /// \deprecated_mitproto
00161     void VFOLD_HOOD(Machine & machine){
00162         Data & result = machine.globals[machine.nextInt8()];
00163         HoodInstructions::fold_hood(machine,result);
00164     }
00165     
00166     /// Filter and fold all imported values for a specific neighbourhood variable and update the corresponding export.
00167     /**
00168      * The fuse function is used to consecutively fuse the previous fuse result with result of the filter applied to the import value of the next neighbour.
00169      * 
00170      * The value of the neighbour hood variable (ie. export) of this machine is set before the folding process starts.
00171      * 
00172      * For example, a neighbourhood with three neighbours (including this machine) is folded like this:
00173      * \dot
00174      * digraph Folding {
00175      *   node [fontsize=10,width=0,height=0];
00176      *   "new export value" -> "export of this machine" -> x -> b -> c -> result;
00177      *   "import of neighbour 1" -> y -> b;
00178      *   "import of neighbour 2" -> z -> c;
00179      *   b [shape=box,label=fuse];
00180      *   c [shape=box,label=fuse];
00181      *   x [shape=box,label=filter];
00182      *   y [shape=box,label=filter];
00183      *   z [shape=box,label=filter];
00184      * }
00185      * \enddot
00186      * 
00187      * \deprecated Implemented for MIT Proto compatibility.
00188      * \note There is currently no way of doing this without using deprecated instructions. (This will be fixed soon.)
00189      * 
00190      * \param Int8 The index of the neighbourhood (ie. import/export) variable.
00191      * \param Address The (address of the) fuse function. (The fold function must take two parameters.)
00192      * \param Address The (address of the) filter function. (The filter function must take one parameter.)
00193      * \param Data The new export value for this Machine.
00194      * 
00195      * \return Data the result of the folding process.
00196      */
00197     void FOLD_HOOD_PLUS(Machine & machine){
00198         HoodInstructions::fold_hood_plus(machine,HoodInstructions::dummy_result);
00199     }
00200     
00201     /// \deprecated_mitproto
00202     void VFOLD_HOOD_PLUS(Machine & machine){
00203         Data & result = machine.globals[machine.nextInt8()];
00204         HoodInstructions::fold_hood_plus(machine,result);
00205     }
00206     
00207     /// \}
00208     
00209 }
